page.title: 01General Resume
page.content: The area is predominantly agricultural land, with some deciduous woodland & includes the large village of Walkern (pop. 1000), & the smaller village of Ardeley (pop. 140) & the hamlets of Bassus Green & Clay End (pop. about 40). Principal crops are wheat & barley, as they were 400 years ago, supplemented by oilseed rape & some lifestock. Although there are a number of small businesses in Walkern, which provide employment for residents & those outside the area, the majority (over 70%) look elsewhere for employ- ment - to Stevenage a few miles away & other nearby towns, & a sizeable minority commute to London. Country people are resistant to change & there is a widespread wish to preserve the community as it is at present; but changes are taking place. The Church, school and pub remain focal points.
